December EWS PRC Meeting Cc an agenda and attendee list for the December Enron Wholesale Services Group PRC meeting The first part of this meeting will involve a review of the PRC results below VP in ENA EIM EGM and ENW in addition to a discussion and approval of promotion nominations The VP preranking will begin at am and will include preranking of VPs in ENA EIM EGM ENW CALME ESA and APACHI Please note on the attendee list which part of the meeting you need to attend The meeting is at the St Regis Hotel however please note a change to the Colonnade Room Should you have any questions regarding this meeting please contact Sheila Knudsen at X in Houston

United Way Executive Solicitation Cc know Enrons United Way Executive Solicitation is well under way August th is the target date to achieve participation and finalize th e commitment from our executives and is also the date for the kickoff of the company wide drive We have a way to go to meet this objective As of August rd less than of our executives have turned in their pledge Enrons United Way goal for the year is million before the corpora te match ENAs share of this goal is While these are aggressiv e goals they are very doable and if everyone contributes their fair share we can easily surpass these goals Along with focusing on meeting our financial goals Id like to have participation throughout the organization This is especially important among our executives We define participation as an employee who has completed their pledge online and made a contribution no matter what the level I am a proud member of the Alexis de Tocqueville Society which is a contributor of or more and have pledged significantly more this yea r than last year Enron has members of this Society only of which are from ENA I would like to see this number increase significantly and if yo u are able I would like you to consider stepping up to this level Given th e fact that Enron executives are highly compensated with generous options and bonus program I encourage each of you to at least become a member of the Make a Difference Club which is a contribution of of your annual salary I would also challenge each of you to increase your pledge this year regardless of your level of giving last year With the campaign going online with electronic pledging Ill need the support of you and your campaigners to increase participation levels across the ENA organization and reach our financial goals Whatever your decision regarding the level of your pledge we need participation from our Executives in order to set a good example for the rest of ENA Your contribution to the United Way will continue to make a difference in our community When you give you change a life right here in our community Please join me in setting the standard for ENA by giving generously and getting your pledges in by August th Login to system on Netscape or Explorer unitedwayenroncom

RE Conference Last Details Cc There is a note for you to be in Monterrey on Wednesday but I cant see any definite travel plans Shall we cancel Nicki Original Message From Kitchen Louise Sent Friday September To Daw Nicki Subject Fw Conference Last Details Is this in my diary Im supposed to be in monterrey next week Sent from my BlackBerry Wireless Handheld Original Message From Williams Jaime Jaime NRONcom To Kitchen Louise Louise NRONcom Sent Fri Sep Subject Conference Last Details Conference for next week I guess it doesnt make sense for you to travel after all that happened this week Numbers are great we have people confirmed already Ill do the welcome Speech and Steves part as well Ill try to get some pictures and send them out to you Best regards

Junior Achievement We Need You Cc to those of you who have already responded regarding the Junior Achievement Job Shadowing program If you have already replied it is not necessary to do so again however there are still a number of you who have not responded and we look forward to hearing from you Please review the memo below and respond to Nicki Daw or Susan Skarness ASAP Your participation is greatly appreciated Thank you Mark Frevert Cliff Baxter Cliff Baxter AM Subject We Need You Some of you were contacted earlier this year by Cliff Baxter Enrons representative on the Junior Achievement Board of Directors regarding participation in Enrons Junior Achievement program Since so many changes have occurred within ENA since that time we are renewing our request and broadening it to reach more departments One of the programs that we wish to support through Junior Achievement is Job Shadowing This programs objectives are to demonstrate why a sound education interpersonal skills and a strong work ethic are needed to succeed in the work place A successful Job Shadowing program requires your departments commitment and participation The Job Shadowing program consists of the following AM Welcome Company Overview Video and Tour N Job Shadow Experience with Enron Employees andor Departments PM Lunch for Students with Mentors and Closing Comments Enron has agreed to accept high school juniors and seniors on the second Wednesday of each month from October through April We need your assistance in hosting students within your department during the AM Noon period Students may be either paired up oneonone with employees or may remain in groups of Employees participating in Job Shadowing will also be invited to join their students for a quick lunch and closing comments If enough departments participate it is possible that each department may only be needed on a quarterly basis Although we have identified two individuals to provide the company overview and tour we are also accepting additional volunteers in this area Please advise if anyone in your department is interested in assisting Please provide the following information to Nicki Daw or Susan Skarness by August Department Name Job Shadowing Contact Name Number of Students Individual to Assist With Tours We appreciate your consideration and participation in promoting Junior Achievement and Enron Cliff Baxter and Mark Frevert

Junior Achievement Cc Wednesday April Enron in conjunction with Junior Achievement will host students from Westside High School and Kerr High School for a day of Job Shadowing This programs objectives are to demonstrate why a sound education interpersonal skills and a strong work ethic are needed t o be successful in the workplace The Job Shadowing program consists of the following AM Students arrive AM Welcome Overview Video and Tours N Individual Job Shadow Experience with Enron Employees PM Student Lunch with Closing Comments PM Students return to schools We need your assistance in identifying individuals within your area who wou ld be available to assist with the job shadowing experience Please contact Nicki Daw ASAP with your recommendations More detailed information will b e supplied to the employees assisting Thank you for your support of the EnronJunior Achievement Job Shadowing program

FW Voluntary Severance ProgramOriginal Message From Enron Europe General CT mailtoIMCEANOTESEnronEuropeGeneralAnnouncementECT NRONcom On Behalf Of Enron Europe Office of the Chairman Sent October To ECT NRON Subject Voluntary Severance Program Voluntary Severance Program We told you in our message last Thursday that details of the program would be given to you by today If he or she has not done so already your business unit head will be scheduling a meeting shortly to discuss the impact of the program on your group If you are interested in finding out more about the program you should visit the Change Programme page on the Enron Europe Intranet site which contains full details including a payment calculator FAQs and an application form Clicking on the hyperlink below should take you directly to the page Thank you John Sherriff and Michael Brown vrmainhtm

UPDATE Houston Astros Games RESCHEDULED Cc The Astros have rescheduled the games that were postponed due to last weeks tragedy Please see the revised schedule and ticket information provided by the Astros Postponed Date Rescheduled Date Giants at Astros Tuesday Tuesday pm Giants at Astros Wednesday Wednesday pm Giants at Astros Thursday Thursday pm Tickets you hold for the th th or th of September are good for the nd rd or th of October respectively AN EXCHANGE OF TICKETS IS NOT NECESSARY The same information applies for parking passes Nicki

United Wayas a pacesetter company is preparing for the annual United Way campaign The official kickoff is Wednesday August th and Enron is hard at work preparing for this event In Enron achieved a increase in contributions compared to and for the th consecutive year we were on e of Houstons largest contributors With your help we can continue this trend and achieve our Enronwide goal for of We are poised to play a significant role in this years campaign I am asking that the head of each business unit nominate one or more individuals from their department to serve as United Way Cheerleaders aka ENA UW Campaigners Please provide one person for every employees in your business unit These volunteers will help ENAs United Way coordinator s promote and educate employees about the United Way and Enrons campaign Last year Enrons companywide participation level was Several busines s units had participation However ENA had the worst rate at Needless to say this is not the position we want to be in at the end of th is years campaign and the campaigners you appoint are vital to improving o ur performance I realize everyone has a busy schedule but this is an important cause and Enron is the recognized champion in the Houston area for our efforts The following individuals who can answer any questions you may have are leading the ENA Campaign Kathie Grabstald ext Michelle Vitrella ext Kim Hillis ext Jennifer Burns ext Once youve selected your departments campaigners please forward their names to Kathie who will coordinate directly with them concerning the responsibilities of a Campaigner and provide support throughout the campaig n All campaigners must attend a short training session within the next week so we need your departments names no later than August at AM Additional Note for Executives VP above and those making more than mo Executive solicitation began July Contribution commitments must be received via the online system by Augus t Executive Breakfasts sponsored by Jeff Skilling Joe Sutton will be hel d August and at DePelchin Childrens Center Please plan to attend one of them If you have any questions please call me or one of our Campaign Coordinators Thank you in advance for your help and support in these efforts

Re Enron North America Corp NYMEX Hedge Exemption ApplicationsFrevert has none From Mark Taylor PM Sent by Enron Announcements To EveryoneinECTCalgary EveryoneinECTLondon EveryoneinECTDenver EveryoneinECTSingapore cc Subject Enron North America Corp NYMEX Hedge Exemption Applications We are in the process of preparing applications for position limit exemptio ns for ENAs NYMEX energy commodities futures trading These applications require that ENA represent whether its officers employees owners or agen ts have a power of attorney control or have a financial interest in any other related commodity futures account either individually or acting with another person pursuant to express or implied agreement Please direct any responses to my paralegal Tana Jones via intercompany email or call her at by the end of business Friday June if you have any power of attorney control or have a financial interes t in any commodity futures account other than an ENA or other trading affiliate account IF YOU DO NOT HAVE A COMMODITY FUTURES ACCOUNT YOU DO NOT NEED TO RESPOND TO THIS REQUEST

Re HOLIDAY PARTY THANKS Cc attached you sent the flowers Nicki From Dorie Hitchcock ECT To Nicki nron cc Subject HOLIDAY PARTY THANKS I wanted to thank everyone involved for the beautiful bouquet of flowers that I received today It was a pleasure working with all of you on the holiday party at Enron Field I appreciate the executives stepping up to the plate so to speak when they were asked to go out on the field You could tell by the roar from the audience that they thoroughly enjoyed the banter I would also like to thank Nicki Daw Kim Hillis Cathy Phillips Jennifer Burns Sue Ford Marsha Schiller Liz Taylor and Kay Chapman for all their efforts and support during the planning of this event My greatest reward is knowing that everyone enjoyed the festivities Thanks again and I wish all of you a very joyous holiday season

CANCELLED EWS Meeting at Management Conference Cc lack of interest this meeting is CANCELLED You are free to continue with your activities as planned If you are around the resort Thursday afternoon Mark would be happy to meet up in one of the bars for an informal get together but no official meeting scheduled Forwarded by Nicki DawNAEnron on Mark Frevert Sent by Nicki Daw To Jeffrey CT Raymond CT David W CT John J nron Mike CT Jeffrey A CT Rebecca McDonaldENRON NRONDEVELOPMENT James A HughesENRON NRONDEVELOPMENT Louise CT John CT Michael nron Philippe A CT cc Greg CT Liz M CT Sue CT Marsha CT Kay CT Kimberly ct Cathy CT Loretta BrelsfordENRON NRONDEVELOPMENT Connie BlackwoodENRON NRONDEVELOPMENT Lauren CT Fiona CT Peggy CT Subject EWS Meeting at Management Conference Greg and I would like to have an informal meeting of our Wholesale leadership team when we meet in San Antonio for the annual Management Conference If your schedule permits we would like to get together at pm on Thursday to talk about the new organization resources next year plans and anything else you would like to discuss Appropriate refreshments will be served Hope to see your there Mark Date Thursday th November Time pm pm Venue Uvalde C Hyatt Regency Hill Country Resort Attendees Philippe Bibi Ray Bowen Michael Brown Dave Delainey Mark Frevert Jim Hughes Louise Kitchen John Lavorato Mike McConnell Rebecca McDonald Jeff McMahon Jeff Shankman John Sherriff Greg Whalley

Re HOLIDAY PARTY THANKS Cc attached you sent the flowers Nicki From Dorie Hitchcock ECT To Nicki nron cc Subject HOLIDAY PARTY THANKS I wanted to thank everyone involved for the beautiful bouquet of flowers that I received today It was a pleasure working with all of you on the holiday party at Enron Field I appreciate the executives stepping up to the plate so to speak when they were asked to go out on the field You could tell by the roar from the audience that they thoroughly enjoyed the banter I would also like to thank Nicki Daw Kim Hillis Cathy Phillips Jennifer Burns Sue Ford Marsha Schiller Liz Taylor and Kay Chapman for all their efforts and support during the planning of this event My greatest reward is knowing that everyone enjoyed the festivities Thanks again and I wish all of you a very joyous holiday season

December EWS PRC Meeting Cc an agenda and attendee list for the December Enron Wholesale Services Group PRC meeting The first part of this meeting will involve a review of the PRC results below VP in ENA EIM EGM and ENW in addition to a discussion and approval of promotion nominations The VP preranking will begin at am and will include preranking of VPs in ENA EIM EGM ENW CALME ESA and APACHI Please note on the attendee list which part of the meeting you need to attend The meeting is at the St Regis Hotel however please note a change to the Colonnade Room Should you have any questions regarding this meeting please contact Sheila Knudsen at X in Houston
